characters: THE SILHOUETTE OF GEORDI LA FORGE
TROI, CRUSHER, WORF, LA FORGE AND RIKER
TALL GRASS BLOWING GENTLY IN A BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: TALL GRASS BLOWING GENTLY IN A BREEZE
dialogues.text: The sound of children playing, running through the grass... as one boy (ARTIM, 12) pokes his head out, we see by his facial skin pattern that he's an alien... his cloths are simple, homespun. As other alien children pursue him in a game of tag into the rocky foothills, we BOOM UP to reveal a breathtaking view of a rural community along a vast sparkling lake... mountains rising in the background...some odd-like livestock graze on the hillside...

dialogues.speaker: A FARM
dialogues.text: A woman uses a bike pump to get well water...a man works the soil in his fields, wipes his brow, waving to --

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN, (ANIJ, 38)
dialogues.text: whose beauty immediately captivates us as she strolls past the farm, the wind barely jostling her close cut curly hair. She takes us to a busy outdoor farmers market at the edge of a hand-constructed village set against a natural rock face barrier. These are the Ba'ku people and from the opening shots we can feel the simple charms of this beautiful place... and who would blame us for wanting to be there, to escape a life like this... where people seem to have all the time in the world... to chat with neighbors, taste a piece of fresh fruit and enjoy the day... Anij nods hello to people including SOJEF (male, 42), the community leader... she smiles as a vendor slices a piece of fruit for her...

dialogues.speaker: ANIJ
dialogues.text: From the point of view of the rock face behind the village. Although we may not realize it yet, we are watching through a window now... slightly discolored, pulling back to see a mysterious figure in an isolation suit standing incongruously beside her, his suit glowing with a green force field. None of the Ba'ku are aware of him as he takes readings with a sophisticated sensor device built into his suit. Now our pullback reveals we're inside a duck blind. Low lighting levels. A bi- level gallery of Starfleet officers and members of an alien race (the Son'a) observe the peaceful village scene like sportswriters at the ballpark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they enter data into their computers. Supernumeraries move in and out of the main viewing room with PADDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, several other cloaked figures move among the unknowing Ba'ku...

dialogues.speaker: THE RANKING SON'A OFFICER, (GALLATIN, 60)
dialogues.text: (OPTICAL) Inside the duck blind. Like all Son'a, his face is stretched like a rubber band about to snap...they look like victims of three too many cosmetic surgeries. He studies a PADD from a supernumerary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Dougherty is waiting for this. Transmit it to the ship. Suddenly a communications crackle on loudspeakers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alert, area twelve...! Now the sound of a weapon blast... turmoil...As the blast echoes through the hills, the Ba'ku outside the window react, turn their heads toward the sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distressed) ... the android has... It crackles off... Gallatin moves to a companel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data, report to base immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transferring... positronic... matrix functions... engaging... secondary protocols... The running man starts pulling at his headgear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to remove the headpiece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All field units. Intercept the android.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDOW
dialogues.text: as all the men in suits converge on the running man... but with superhuman strength, he tosses them aside with ease... Meanwhile Ba'ku people, unaware of the fight, greet their children back, happy they're safe...

dialogues.speaker: ARTIM
dialogues.text: as he moves to Sojef, his father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have been some kind of odd electrical storm... But as Sojef speaks, Artim turns to see the floating head of Data DECLOAKING in mid-air barely a yard away as he removes his helmet... the boy yells... jumps back, falling as Data makes eye contact with him. The Ba'ku scatter... Sojef pulls the boy away to safety...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondary protocols... active. We notice a slashing burn wound on Data's neck as he fights off an invisible force again... we hear a ripping crunch and a green force field sputters briefly -- a Son' man in a torn isolation suit partially DECLOAKS as he is slammed to the ground, unconscious. Data rips off the rest of his suit revealing himself, picks up a weapon from the unconscious Son'a, aims it at the rock face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The observers dive for cover as he points the weapon this way. But Data fires it to the left of the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then fires again to the right... and again above... each hit knocking out generators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finally the rock face shimmers, like a computer image breaking up, and disappears revealing the high-tech stations behind it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the invisible men in suits DECLOAK in the village.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE DUCK BLIND WINDOW
dialogues.text: The scientists begin to poke their heads up from the floor... exposed to the world outside...

dialogues.speaker: THE BA'KU IN HIDING PLACES
dialogues.text: including Anij, Artim and Sojef react with shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: stands alone, satisfied with his mysterious work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In orbit of an M-class planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the four Captain's pips on his uniform, and moving back to reveal BEVERLY CRUSHER helping JEAN-LUC PICARD fasten the collar on his jacket as DEANNA TROI briefs him, glancing at a PADD. All are wearing formal uniforms. They are running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Population three hundred million...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say the greeting again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yew-cheen chef-faw... emphasis on the 'cheen' and the 'faw'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You either need a new uniform or a new neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Yew-cheen chef-faw'... My collar size is exactly the same as it was at the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Sure it is. And your hair is still chestnut brown. Our angle clearly establishes Picard's white hair... she finishes with the collar... overlapping the above dialogue: a chime at the door, Troi answers it, letting in WILL RIKER in his dress uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guests have arrived and are eating the floral arrangements on the banquet tables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they don't believe in cocktails before dinner... As Picard leads the way out of the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her PADD) Oh, my God, are they vegetarians? That's not in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better have the chef whip up a light balsamic vinaigrette... something that goes well with chrysanthemums...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very up-tempo dialogue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yew-cheen chef-faw...     Bridge to Captain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Ensign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Command wants to know our ETA at the Goren systsem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Riker) The Goren system...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need us to mediate some territorial dispute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) We can't delay the archaeological expedition to Hanoran Two. It would put us into the middle of monsoon season...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't be helped) The Diplomatic Corps is busy with Dominion negotiations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) ... so they need us to put out one more brush fire. (beat) Anyone remember when we used to  be explorers? They enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (refocussing) 'Yew-cheen chef-faw.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deck ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resuming her briefing) Remember; they have a significantly less advanced technology than ours... they only achieved warp drive last year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year? And the Federation Coucil decided to make them a Protectorate already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In view of our losses to the Borg and the Dominion, the Coucil feels we need all the allies we can get these days. As the turbolift doors open, we see much activity, can hear music coming from the party... Picard puts on a brighter face. As they exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be expected to dance with Regent Cuzar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can she mambo...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Riker & Troi's reactions) Your Captain used to cut quite a rug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several officers in dress uniform move to make room for the Captain's entourage... moving with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain on deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Forge to Picard. Captain, I need to talk to you before you go into the reception... Before Picard can respond, he runs into Worf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf, what the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at the Manzar colony       It's a little late,    installing a new defense         Geordi... can it wait? perimeter when I heard the Enterprise was in this sector...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop by my quarters later;       I don't think so  I have a few ideas about         Commander..   Manzar security... (non-stop to Riker) Have him come to the  reception... we'll talk  here... Picard moves into the banquet room, continuing to Worf --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your bride?                The Captain wants you to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A challenge                      I'm on my way... tell hi PICARD                     communique from Admiral Then you were made for           Dougherty... each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe thirty Starfleet officers, most human but a few Bajorans, Trills and Borians peppered about... a small group of musicians play a festive tune. The crowd moves back as their Captain enters and Troi escorts him to REGENT CUZAR, 50 and her delegation of about eight extremely short aliens... she's at least a foot shorter than he is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yew-cheen chef-faw, Regent Cuzar. Welcome aboard the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Picard, may I welcome you in the time-honored tradition of my people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aide steps forward and she takes an alien headpiece from him and reaches up to put it on Picard's head... Picard has to make himself shorter to make it work... the other aliens throw tiny seeds over Picard and Cuzar (like rice at a wedding)... Picard smiles, trying not to show how silly he feels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are so honored to be accepted within the great Federation family. (excusing him) Please, I know you have other guests to greet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a dance later, I believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to it. One of her misters escorts her away, Picard turns to Troi -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to dance? Her head will be in my... He's interrupted by GEORDI LA FORGE who approaches looking concerned, holding a PADD, hands it to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Admiral Dougherty's aboard the Son'a ship in sector four-four-one. He's requesting Data's schematics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message doesn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Data should have been back by now. They were only scheduled to observe the Ba'ku village for a week. (to Geordi) Set up a secured com-link to the Admiral in the anteroom... Geordi acknowledges, moves away... a Bolian science officer grabs Picard by the arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Hars Adislo, we met at the Nel Bato Conference last year... did you ever have a chance to read my paper on thermionic transconductance...? As Picard reacts, smiling with no recollection...

dialogues.speaker: A MONITOR
dialogues.text: Admiral MATTHEW DOUGHERTY, 69, a confident, charismatic officer is transmitting from a Son'a ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not acknowledging any Starfleet protocols... not responding to any of our hails... We pull back to see we're in a small room off the reception... Picard faces the monitor (he's removed the headpiece). Geordi observes. A Starfleet Ensign stands guard just outside the door to make sure they're not disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what precipitated his behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) ... And now he's holding our people hostage down there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise can be at your position in two days, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably not a good idea. Your ship hasn't been fitted for this region; there are environmental concerns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of concerns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't fully identified the anomalies yet. They're calling this whole area The Briar Patch... it took us a day to reach a location where we could get a signal out to you. Just get me Data's schematics. I'll keep you informed. (Picard acknowledges) Dougherty out. The screen returns to a starfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him the schematics. Geordi acknowledges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving inside) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report to the galley and tell the chef to skip the fish course. The Ensign gives a puzzled reaction but an order is an order. He exits. Geordi gives his Captain a curious look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want our guests to depart as quickly a etiquette allows. I'll ask Worf to delay his return to DS9 so he can join us. We're going to stop by sector four-four- one on our way to the Goren system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) They... are in opposite directions, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Are they...? La Forge smiles, leaves. Picard takes a beat to collect himself and we may sense how the clutter in a Captain's life may wear him down. He puts the alien headpiece back on with sullen eyes...  then restores his diplomat's face and returns to the reception...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving toward a ringed planet well in the distance, passing slowly through wisps of space matter... wonderful, glowing plasma tendrils like legs of a gigantic tarantula dotted by low density gas clouds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low lighting. Strange futuristic dialysis machines pump fluids in and out of reclined Son'a men and women... the women use powder and heavy but carefully applied make-up to obscure their faces. Son'a costumes are made of expensive fabrics with latinum chains and exquisite jewels as accessories, suggesting a wealthy culture that values materialism. Sexy female attendants from various alien races, dressed provocatively, work with laser tools to repair cracked, raw skin off Son'a faces. We move to find RU'AFO, 63, the Son'a Ahdar (Commander), reclining getting an elaborate facial from two beauties, creams and oils massaged into his skin by their gentle fingertips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have never let you talk me into the duck blind in the first place... Reveal Admiral Dougherty observing, wearing a crisp, Starfleet uniform... he looks and feels out of place here, but such are the demands of alien alliances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Federation procedures have made this mission ten times as difficult as it needed to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our procedures were in place to protect the planet's population from unnecessary risk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planet's population. Six hundred people. You want to avoid unnecessary risks? Next time leave your android home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Ahdar Ru'afo. We're approaching the planet. He motions to the girls to finish up, presses his personal comlink, answering the call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us into a high orbit. (as he rises from the chair) Lie down, Admiral. The girls will take twenty years off your face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time. Ru'afo studies his own face in the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your self-restraint puzzles me, Admiral. You continue to deny yourself every benefit this mission has to offer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer to wait until we can share the benefits with all the people of the Federation...  Suddenly, boom! The ship is hit by a blast. Ru'afo reacts, leads the way out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ru'afo and Dougherty enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phaser blast. Unknown origin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise shields. (another blast) Take us out of orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photon torpedoes.  Brace for impact! Blam... again... and again... serious hits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning. Outer hull damage, deck three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual contact! On the viewscreen the attacking ship moves suddenly into view from a low density gas cloud like a destroyer emerging from a fog bank... it is a Federation Scout ship small but impressive, with windows at the forward cockpit... the Admiral reacts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it moves at us, firing one last blast which illuminates the pilot for a instant and we clearly see the face of Data through the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at warp, in normal space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the replicator. An allegro chamber music piece in the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea. Earl Grey. Hot. The tea appears as we pull back to reveal Picard studying a PADD... he reaches out for the tea without his eyes ever leaving his reading... walks across the room and sits at a dining table that has stacks of various work materials... more PADDS, charts and graphs and maps... a half-eaten salad sits in front of him... and in a move that would challenge the world's greatest juggler, he pokes a fork of salad into his mouth with one hand as he sips his tea with the other, finding a spot to prop the PADD so he can still read... and now, his mind, asking a  silent question, reaching over to grab a chart, and as he pulls it over, he also spills the salad plate splashing gorgonzolla dressing over his jacket... sighs... a chime at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Riker... Picard looks at himself, shrugs, what the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come... Riker enters with a PADD, eyes drawn to Picard's stained jacket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the casualty of a working  lunch. Picard takes off his jacket... and as the scene continues, he changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been going over the few star charts we have of this "Briar Patch". It's full of supernova remnants, false vacuum fluctuations... Riker looks at the star chart, brushes it off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and gorgonzolla cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't be able to go any faster than one-third impulse in that muck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the PADD) Nothing dangerous turned up in the astrometric survey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are the 'environmental concerns' the Admiral was talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) The only unusual readings were low levels of metaphasic radiation from interstellar dust across the region...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Captain Picard. We are approaching sector four-four-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow to impulse. We're on our way. Picard leads the way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The edge of the dangerous and beautiful region... moving to find the Enterprise approaching at impulse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the Patch on the viewscreen... Worf at tactical, ENSIGN KELL PERIM, female Trill, 29, at Conn... Troi at command, La Forge at Ops... as Picard and Riker enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to lose communications with Starfleet, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Troi) Do you have everything you need from command?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've downloaded all the files on the duck blind mission as well as intelligence reports on the Son'a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (including Riker) You have two days to become experts... Mister Worf, your job and mine will be to find a plan to safely capture Data. Worf holds up a modified tricorder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already modified a tricorder with one of his spare actuation servos. Its operational range is only seven meters but it should shut him down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciating his initiative) It's good to have you back, Worf. (he sits) Slow to one-third. Take us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it moves slowly into The Patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Significantly electronic... many computer stations... a few real books... Troi and Riker work at parallel computer stations... people are at other stations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off her computer) The Son'a discovered an M-class planet with humanoid life six  months ago. Turned out it's in us to get approval for a  sociological study. The  Federation Council suggested it be a joint mission...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was Data assigned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Environmental concerns", again. An android could be safely exposed to the elements during the installation of a duck blind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshhh... They turn to see -- a middle-aged, prune-faced woman at a desk, looking sternly at them... Troi goes back to her reading but seems distracted... sees a paper notepad on the desk, rips off a shred and, during the following exchange, starts to press it between her thumb and forefinger into a little ball. Whispering now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything to suggest the Son'a have any interest in sociology...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they interested in...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wine, women and song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should feel right at home with them. She throws the ball of paper and hits Riker on the side of the head... he turns but she's looking innocently at  her screen... he rolls a little paper ball himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomadic, collectors of precious metals, jewels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) Hmm, I should feel right at home with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in luck... it says here they've taken women from several races as indentured servants. Just as he's about to throw his paper ball back at her... he sees the librarian staring at him... Riker, caught, sheepishly turns back to his computer... a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) Look at this... She stands, leaning over Riker's shoulder to see his computer, putting one arm on the desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Son'a have been suspected of producing mass quantities of the narcotic ketracel-white... their ships are rumored to be equipped with isolytic subspace weapons outlawed by the Second Khitomer Accord...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it rests gently on his upper arm... and he's deeply aware of that breast touching him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would we be involved with these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. They exchange a brief glance that has nothing to do with  the Son'a. As his eyes return to the computer scrolling, she casually plays with hair at the nape of his neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't done that in a long time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're doing to my neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirtatiously) Was I doing something to your neck? He pauses his scrolling as he comes to something curious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says here that some form of genetic damage has apparently prevented the Son'a from procreating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's true, they're a dying race.  Suddenly, a tiny ball of paper hits Riker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... He turns to see an alien ensign looking too innocently at his computer. The librarian's eyes fix on Riker and Troi, obvious troublemakers... Troi points to Riker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started it. Riker reacts, starts to leave... Troi follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything, I swear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it continues slowly through The Briar Patch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Worf asleep in bed, an alarm already beeping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Commander Worf... Worf begins to stir... then his eyes open and he realizes the alarm is going off... he sits up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how they do it on Deep Space Nine... but on the Enterprise, we still report for duty on time. Worf stands in the dark, bumping his head as he does... INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard at command... La Forge at Ops... Perim at conn... LIEUTENANT NARA, human male, 35, at Tactical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I must have slept through my alarm. I'm on my way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll skip the court martial this time... Picard out. A beat as Picard listens to the sound of his ship, raises an eyebrow... we hear nothing... he moves forward to La Forge and Perim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time we aligned our torque sensors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months ago, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't sound right. La Forge and Perim react, work the controls, exchange a look at the results...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torque sensors are out of alignment... by twelve microns... you could hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself) When I was an ensign, I could detect a three-micron mis- alignment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. The Son'a ship                         with Admiral Dougherty aboard has entered tracking range...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to hail them. A disheveled and embarrassed Worf enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Dougherty responding. Worf replaces Nara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straighten your baldric, Commander. On screen...

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE THE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: Dougherty and Ru'afo are sitting in Ru'afo's tactical room, opulently decorated for a spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I wasn't expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was too important for the Enterprise to be on the sidelines, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had better news. Commander Data attacked us in the mission scout ship yesterday. Ru'afo and I have decided to send in an assault team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Commander Worf and I have been working on several tactical plans to safely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your android has turned dangerously violent, Captain... Considerable damage was done to my ship. He must be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what Data means to Starfleet, Jean-Luc... but our crew is at the mercy of those people on the planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If our first attempt to capture Data fails, I will terminate him. (beat) I should be the one to do it. I'm his Captain. And his friend. Dougherty pauses to consider but Ru'afo wants none of Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't safe for you to remain in this area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. Our shields have been upgraded to protect against the environmental anomalies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't noticed any ill effects. The Admiral studies him a long beat, is sympathetic to Picard's position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. You have twelve hours, Captain. Then I want you out of The Briar Patch. In the meantime, we'll be heading out to the perimeter to call for Son'a reinforcements in case you fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Dougherty out. His image disappears. On Picard's expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bay door slides open and a shuttle emerges... move through the gas clouds toward the beautiful ringed planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf and Picard at the controls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensors are not picking up any ships coming from the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmit a wide band co-variant signal. That'll get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches panel) He might be using the planet's rings to mask his approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off sensors) The metaphasic radiation in those rings is in a state of extreme flux. Steer clear of them, Mister Worf... A beat. Watching and waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out, come out wherever you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm? Oh, it's just something my mother used to... Suddenly, wham -- a blast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. He hits the controls and they climb sharply...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: evading phaser shots form the scout... the planet providing a dramatic backdrop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open all hailing frequencies. (Worf acknowledges) Data, this is Captain Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windows showing a gas cloud outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... please acknowledge... Data ignores him, continues to fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving through the dark clouds, pursuing the shuttle, firing phasers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More shots connect... more sharp evasive maneuvers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if we fire a tachyon burst, it may force him to reset his shield harmonics. When he does, we could beam him out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires a tachyon burst...

dialogues.speaker: 53A THE SCOUT
dialogues.text: the blast connects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Direct hit. He's resetting his shield harmonics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beam him out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which wheezes unsuccessfully... they react...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's activated a transport inhibitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare to enter the atmosphere... we'll use the ionospheric boundary to shake him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY (OPTICAL) The shuttle blasts through the atmosphere attempting to shake off the scout...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard works hard to stabilize the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanners are off line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evasive maneuvers... heading one- four-zero mark three-one... Then, wham... wham... WHAM! Gas shoots from the ceiling... Worf tries to stop it...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: to see the Scout zooming past, so close that Picard and Data can even make eye contact... Picard works to avoid him again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can fly a ship, he anticipates tactical strategies, his brain is obviously functioning... We've seen how he responds to threats. I wonder how he'd respond to... Another shot connects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a new idea) Do you know Gilbert and Sullivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I haven't had a chance to meet all the new crew members since I've been back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're composers, Worf, from the nineteenth century. Data was rehearsing a part in H.M.S. Pinafore before he left... (singing to com) "A British tar is a soaring soul, As free as a mountain bird, His energetic first should be ready to resist A dictatorial word..." Picard looks at Worf, nods, join me! Worf gives him an exasperated look...  Picard begins to enter commands into the computer as he continues to sing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His nose should pant and his lip should curl, His cheeks should flame and his brow should furl..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data reacts. From somewhere inside his damaged brain, he recalls this song. He starts to sing to himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) "His bosom should heave and his heart should glow, and his fist be ready for a knock-down blow..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lyrics are scrolling on a monitor now... a bouncing ball making it easier for Worf to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Worf) Sing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His nose should pant and his lip should curl, his cheeks should flame and his brow should furl..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Data sings in unison --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... His bosom should heave and his heart should glow... And his fist be ready for a knock-down blow..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard catches his breath, turns off the companel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stopped firing. Suddenly from the speaker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His eyes should flash with an inborn fire, His brow should scorn be wrung; he never should bow down to a domineering frown, Or the tang of a tyrant tongue..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, triumphant) Prepare the docking clamps. Worf moves to a rear panel as Picard sings with Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... His foot should stamp..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data, mesmerized by the song, is not paying attention to his sensors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... and his throat should growl, His hair should twirl and his face should scowl..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shuttle moves within yards, even feet, of the scout... sliding under the belly of Data's craft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) "... His eyes should flash and his breast protrude, And this should be his customary attitude --"

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCKING CLAMP
dialogues.text: on the roof of the shuttle extends and with a magnetic jolt attaches itself to the scout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... His foot should stamp and his throat should growl..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data feels the jolt, reacts, stops singing, his programs clinking back into a defense mode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His hair should twirl and his face should scowl..." Data checks his sensors, hits a panel and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the scout rocks back and forth trying to shake the shuttle loose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard and Worf hold on for dear life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, inertial coupling is exceeding tolerance... if we don't release him, he may destroy both vessels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting go of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to spin and spiral downwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data still trying to free his ship... the surface spinning and looming closer through the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning. Impact with surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same view of the surface through their window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reroute emergency power to inertial dampers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damping sequencer was damaged by phaser fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transferring controls to manual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning. Impact with surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damping field established!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maximum power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle gains control sweeping both ships into a hard arc parallel to the surface, only a dozen yards above the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data reacts to a hatch being blown open on the floor behind him, turns to see Worf aiming the modified tricorder at him... Worf presses a button, nothing happens... Data looks curiously at him... then lunges at him, but Worf extends his arm and presses the button again and Data shuts off in mid-lunge and falls motionless, inches from Worf. He presses his combadge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Data is safely in custody. Picard takes a deep breath... satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages are sitting at wooden tables with the Ba'ku having lunch, the Son'a quietly keeping to themselves at separate tables. To the side, Artim and friends play a game (TBD) that displays extraordinary hand-eye coordination, well beyond human abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and several engineers enter the village on foot, phasers drawn, their faces curious at the picnic before them... the hum of conversation fades... for a moment, it almost seems that the hostages are sorry to seem them... Gallatin and the Starfleet lieutenant move to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Subahdar Gallatin, Son'a Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Curtis, attach, to Admiral Dougherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been treated extremely well by these people. The children have resumed their game. Troi observes them with keen interest... Picard notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have an incredible clarity of perception, Captain. I've never encountered a species with such mental discipline... Sojef, Anij and several of the Ba'ku, including another village leader, TOURNEL (35), move toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Sojef, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Luc Picard... my officers Doctor Crusher and Counselor Troi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're here to... rescue them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. But I would ask you to disarm yourselves. This village is a sanctuary of life. Picard measures the request... then holsters his phaser... the rest of the away team does the same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crusher and Troi) Prepare to transport the 'hostages' to the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should be quarantined before joining the ship's population. Picard nods. They move off with Gallatin and the Lieutenant. The work crew moves to disassemble the duck blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sojef) We were under the impression they were being held against their will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not our custom to have guests here at all, let alone hold anyone against their will. Picard makes eye contact with Anij... her tone is not harsh, but we can sense an inner strength in this woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The artificial lifeform would not allow them to leave. He told us they were our enemies and more would follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you our enemy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people have a strict policy of non-interference with other cultures. In fact, it's our Prime Directive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry, with a smile) Your directive apparently doesn't include spying on other cultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were in your shoes, I'd feel the same way after what happened. (beat) The 'artificial lifeform' is a member of my crew. Apparently, he became... ill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There did seem to be a phase variance in the positronic matrix that we were unable to repair. Picard reacts, not the sort of thing one expects to hear from someone in a place like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the Captain finds it hard to believe that we'd have any skills repairing a positronic device...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our technological abilities aren't apparent because we've chosen not to employ them in our daily lives. We believe when you create a machine to do the work of a man, you take something away from the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (don't take us lightly) But at one time, we explored the galaxy just as you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have warp capability?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capability, yes. But where can warp drive take us, except away from here...? Clearly establishing that she and her people have very little interest in life beyond their world. Picard allows himself to take in this glorious setting... a humming bird hovers briefly nearby... it is the kind of paradise that would appeal to any contemporary man trying to escape the clutter of his life if only for a brief respite... and at least, to that extent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. In the background, the Starfleet hostages embrace their hosts as they say farewell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for our intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard talks to Dougherty on a monitor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and because they have warp capabilities, the consequences to their society are minimal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done a terrific job, Jean- Luc. Now, pack your bags and get  the hell out of there. How's Data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In stasis. La Forge is completing the diagnostic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acknowledge) I'll need all your paperwork tomorrow. We're heading back your way. Set a course to rendezvous with us so you can transfer the crew and equipment on your way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not finished here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few loose ends to tie up. Dougherty out. Picard turns off the monitor, glances at the pile of work PADDS -- his "paperwork" -- on his desk without pleasure...  picks one up and begins to study it for a beat... then is drawn to the window, where he can see the warm inviting planet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sitting on the sofa making some notes on a PADD when the door chimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. (Riker enters) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a minute? I... need a little counseling. (off her surprise) First time for everything. Do I... lie down... or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever makes you comfortable... Riker lies down, only he winds up with his head on her lap looking up at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't one of the usual therapeutic postures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try sitting up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could try lying down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in quite a mood today. He finally sits up, stealing a kiss along the way... she rises shocked but not upset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really need counseling or did you come down here to play? Riker is on his feet now, approaching her. She retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. (off her look) I think I'm having a mid-life crisis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (retreating) ... I believe you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm not sleeping well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Doctor Crusher has something that'll take care of that... She allows him to catch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I need, I can't get from Doctor Crusher... (inches away) Counselor, do you think it's possible for two people to go back in time to fix a mistake they've made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this ship, anything can happen. And usually does. He closes the gap between them, kisses her deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never kissed you with a beard  before. She pushes him out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kiss you and you say 'augh'?! She hits the panel and the door slides closed in his face... a tiny grin comes to her face...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: LA FORGE La Forge has a headache he's trying to work through... he shows Picard several burned components...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took these out of Data's neural net... they contain memory engrams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how they were damaged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a Son'a weapon. (off Picard's look) There's no doubt about it, sir. That's what made Data malfunction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son'a reports claim they didn't fire until after he malfunctioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it happened that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they fire at him without provocation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that he was functioning normally until he was shot. Then, his fail-safe system was activated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fail-safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ethical and moral subroutines took over all of his basic functions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying he still knew the difference between right and wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sense, that's all he knew. The system is designed to protect him against anyone who might try to take advantage of his memory loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet he attacked us. And told the Ba'ku we were a threat... 'Why?' is the unspoken question on Picard's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a door with a significant security system in place... Geordi hits several panels... Picard notices his eye discomfort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Implants bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. I'm just tired. The door slides open to reveal a closet-sized space with Data mounted on the wall in a diagnostic device... Geordi touches a panel which activates Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Geordi...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're aboard the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had a serious malfunction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going inward a beat) I seem to be missing several memory engrams... Geordi holds up the damaged components for him to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... that looks like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the last thing you remember, Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching his memory, signs) 'his nose should pant and his lip should curl...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the mission...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in an isolation suit collecting physiometric data on Ba'ku children. My last memory is going into the hills, following a boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artim is playing with a tiny 'palm-pet', a colorful cross between a caterpillar and a jellyfish that crawls over his hand and between his fingers, as Sojef moves over with Picard and Data... the boy looks at Data with fear in his eyes. Data can't help but notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artim, do you remember where you were on the day of lightning when the artificial lifeform appeared to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hills, by the dam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you show us? Artim puts his pet in a pocket (or it can have its own little pouch on Artim's belt if he has no pockets) and  leads  the way. Several Ba'ku including Anij and Tournel curiously follow. As Picard makes eye contact with her, she moves over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you disrupted our lives enough...? She says it gently, but honestly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand how you feel. We  just want to retrace Data's movements that day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a cautious reply) I don't like to leave questions unanswered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) Then you must spend your life answering questions. She moves away. Picard watches her; she doesn't look back.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: Who notices Artim still glancing at him with fear. To reassure him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no need for concern. I  am operating within normal parameters now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am better. The android's manner only seems to frighten Artim more. Before Data can say anything else, Sojef comes and leads him away, giving Data a cool smile that says, in effect, I don't want any artificial lifeform talking to my son. Data reacts. After a thoughtful beat, moves to walk with Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the boy is... afraid... of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing personal data. You have to remember these people have rejected technology. And you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I am the personification of  everything they have rejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until this week, that young man probably never saw a  machine, let alone one that walks and talks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I do not believe I made a very good first impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It clearly bothers Data to be the object of fear. The boy glances over his shoulder once more at the android, looks quickly away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the group moves into the rocky foothills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enchanted by the natural beauty, the antithesis of  clutter.

dialogues.speaker: NEW ANGEL
dialogues.text: They come to a brook. Artim hops on one foot across rocks in the water and without stopping to think, Picard does the same thing, looking like a little boy... then notices a curious look from Data which makes him collect himself and adjust his jacket. Anij glances over at Sojef with concern. The others cross in adult fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the first bolt of lightning over there... As they move along the rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a 24th century container of Gillette Foamy Shaving Cream ("For weightless Environments!")... finding a female hand with a straight razor moving to Riker's face... his chin and cheeks lathered with cream... and the hand is Troi's and they're in the bathtub together in a bubble bath... she expertly moves the blade across his face, leaving a swath of bare chin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Riker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get back to you, Worf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Dougherty's on the com- link, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Patch him through. (the computer bleeps) Yes, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougherty in the foreground; behind him a Son'a physician is pulling green scum from subcutaneous boils under the skin of Ru'afo's neck with a syringe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you left orbit yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Picard is still on the surface, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't want to leave until we could adequately explain why Data malfunctioned. His future in Starfleet could depend on it. Dougherty exchanges a concerned look with Ru'afo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind the captain his twelve hours are up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougherty out. Ru'afo's eyes are closed, as the green goo moves from his neck to the doctor's syringe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body is producing far too many toxins... we've reached the limit of genetic manipulation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't need any more genetic manipulation if our Federation friends will allow us to complete this mission. He opens his eyes, gives Dougherty a pointed look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAKE Picard, Data and the Ba'ku have moved toward a dam where Data is having trouble with is tricorder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tricorder functions are limited due to heavy deposits of kelbonite in these hills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a passive radiation scan? Data adjusts his tricorder... reacts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, there appear to be strong neutrino emissions coming from the lake... Staying with Data s he follows the tricorder to the edge of the lake... a brief pause... and then in a Harold Lloyd sort of moment, he steps into the lake up to his ankles, pauses again to look at the tricorder and then disappears under water.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIM
dialogues.text: reacts, astounded... looks to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he breathe under water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data doesn't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't he rust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles to himself) No. The boy turns his wide eyes back toward the lake.

dialogues.speaker: DATA, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: An eel and a fish investigate him as he stands on the lake bottom, examining his tricorder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data emerges at a distance from the others... calling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I believe I know what is causing the neutrino emissions... He climbs to the top of the earthen dam and turns a heavy wheel that might usually require the strength of two men, opening a floodgate... as he does --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fascinated) Are there other machines like him in the offland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The offland is no concern of yours.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: The water continues to run off and as we push to the falling water...

dialogues.speaker: 98B WITH PICARD
dialogues.text: reacting as he looks down at the lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a strange displacement of water appearing as the lake drains... something invisible is sitting in the water... a bird lands on top of it... and as the water sinks lower, spilling off the sides of the invisible object, the shape is revealed to be that of a cloaked spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is clearly Federation in origin, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting Dougherty) 'Just a few loose ends to tie up.' As they move to a rowboat... Artim begins to follow but Sojef puts a firm arm on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not interested in such things. Anij looks to Sojef...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. And she hops onto the rowboat with Picard and Data... decidedly not trusting either of them to go alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be wiser for you to stay on shore. Anij's answer is to grab an oar and push them away from shore... as Data and Picard exchange a glance, Picard takes the oar from her and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, Anij and Data row closer to the invisible ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data presses controls on his tricorder. A hatch opens. Picard and Data draw phasers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they climb in to find themselves in an identical image of the Ba'ku village. Anij is stunned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) It is a holographic projection. Moving to a gap that shows the metal holo-grid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incomplete, I might add.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anij) What you're seeing is a computer driven image created by photons and forcefields...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what a hologram is, Captain. The question is -- why would someone want to create one of our village?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, considering) Data, if you were following the boy and discovered this ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it is conceivable I was shot to protect the secret of its existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, musing aloud) What possible purpose could a duplicate village have except... to deceive the Ba'ku...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceive us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To move you off this planet. You go to sleep one night in your village... wake up the next morning in this flying holodeck transported en masse. A week later, maybe a month, you've been relocated on a similar planet without ever realizing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would the Federation or the Son'a wish to move the Ba'ku?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We may notice a look in Anij's eyes - she knows why but doesn't intend to say. Picard and Data don't notice her reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly wham! -- a plasma charge is fired from the shadows of the "village" hologram... and then another and another... the shots hit walls revealing portions of the holo-grid (an effect we will see again later during the final action). Plasma ricochets off the walls spraying sparks over them all... as Data fires back, Picard grabs Anij and shoves her out of the hatch for her safety...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she falls several yards into the water making a big splash... Picard turns back and starts firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief, intense exchange of shots... creating more gaps in the holo-image... and finally a Son'a officer falls off the roof of a holo-building, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, end program and decloak the vessel. And as the holo-image DEMATERIALIZES, they're standing on a holodeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECLOAKING... Anij splaying her arms to keep afloat in the water... Picard and Data stick their heads out of the hatch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't swim! Data and Picard promptly jump in after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for her) Don't panic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with some humor) I've been shot at... thrown into the lake out of an invisible ship that's come to abduct us all... what's there to panic about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the event of a water landing, I have been designed to serve as a floatation device. He twists his neck a certain way and we hear a slight technical re-alignment and suddenly he floats...she hangs on as Picard swims over to retrieve the rowboat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data and Picard MATERIALIZE... Worf, sporting a large red mark on his nose, observes. Picard is still wet and angry... on the move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did any of the hostages mention a cloaked ship during their debriefings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debrief them again. (noticing) Have you been in a fight, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humiliated) No, sir. It is a gorch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorch? Data leans in and whispers the translation into Picard's ear... Picard is embarrassed he brought it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well, it's hardly... noticeable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Data's deadpan look at Picard, as they exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker with his clean shaven face moving to meet them... Picard and Data react... Riker smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth as an android's bottom, eh, Data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... beg your pardon, sir? For the rest of the sequence, Data observes Riker's chin. Moving to the turbolift...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Dougherty wants to know why we haven't left yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere. Worf and Riker exchange a glance as they enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deck five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the gorge) You Klingons never do anything small, do you... The doors close. Ignoring Riker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Crusher asked to talk to you when you returned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard to Crusher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the Son'a hostages declined to be examined. I had them confined to quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all have slightly elevated levels of endorphin production... probably the result of the environmental anomalies here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they in any danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. They're fine... in fact, they're better than fine. Increased metabolism, high energy, improved muscle tone. We should all be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Doctor. Picard out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming out of the turbolift toward Picard's quarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son'a officers are not to be released until I've met with Ahdar Ru'afo. He enters his quarters. Data finally submits to his curiosity and runs a finger along Riker's chin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. It is not. (off Riker's look) As smooth as an android's bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, music. Picard's favorite chamber music comes on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not that. Something else. Something... Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please specify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mambo. (as the music comes on, his tension easing) That's more like it... Picard moves to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his jacket and shirt... and begins to towel himself dry... as he glances in the mirror... his towel patting his face, slows to a stop as he stares at himself in the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: THE HAIR AROUND HIS EAR
dialogues.text: is changing color, no longer all white, it is now predominantly chestnut brown.

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: looks, his mind adding up all the strange little things that have been happening on the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard knocks on a door... it is opened by Anij...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you? TIME CUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austere but inviting with a warm fire... Sojef, Tournel and Artim have joined them... Artim spoons hot cider from a kettle into cups, serves it to the adults as the scene continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here from a solar system on the verge of self- annihilation... where technology had created weapons that threatened to destroy all life. A small group of us set off to find a new home... a home that would be isolated from the threats of other worlds. (beat) That was three hundred and nine years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) You've not aged a day since then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was a good deal older when we arrived... in terms of my physical condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an unusual metaphasic radiation coming from the planet's rings. It continuously regenerates the cells in our bodies. You must have noticed the effects by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've... just begun to. (to Artim) I suppose you're seventy-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metaphasic radiation won't begin to affect him until he reaches maturity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To many offlanders, what you have here would be more valuable than gold-pressed latinum. (beat) And I'm afraid it's the reason that someone is trying to take this world away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The artificial lifeform was right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not for Data, you'd probably have been re-located by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we possibly defend ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment we pick up a weapon, we become one of them... we lose everything we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may not come to that. They turn to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, the architects of this conspiracy have tried to keep it a secret. Not just from you, but from my people as well. (beat) I don't intend to let them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've always known that to survive, we had to remain apart. It hasn't been easy. Many of the young people here want to know more about the offland... they're attracted to stories of a faster pace of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of my people who live that faster pace would sell their souls to slow it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) There are days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, studying him) You don't live up to your reputation as an offlander, Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-effacing) In defense of offlanders, there are many more like me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... who wouldn't be tempted by the promise of perpetual youth? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give me more credit than I deserve. Of course, I'm tempted. Who wouldn't be? (beat) But some of the blackest marks in the history of my world have involved the forced relocation of a small group of people to satisfy the demands of a larger one. I'd like to believe we learn from our mistakes. Obviously, some of us haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard pausing to look in a corner window... beautifully hand-crafted quilts are displayed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craftsmanship is extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) This is a school... that's a student's work. (off his reaction) She'll be ready to become an apprentice soon. Then, in thirty or forty years, she'll take her place among the artisans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An apprentice for thirty years. (they continue walking) We've noticed your people's mental discipline. Did that develop here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) More questions. Always the explorer. If you stay long enough, that'll change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stop reviewing what happened yesterday... stop planning for tomorrow... until you find... (interrupting herself) Let me ask you a question -- have you ever experienced a perfect moment in time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When time seemed to stop... and you could almost live in that moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing my home planet from space for the first time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Exactly. Nothing more complicated than perception. (beat) You explore the universe. We've discovered a single moment in time can be a universe in itself... full of powerful forces... most people aren't aware enough of the now... to ever notice them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could spare a few centuries to learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took us centuries to learn that it doesn't have to take centuries to learn. They reach a doorway to her home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one thing I don't understand. (off her look) In three hundred years...you never learned to swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I just... haven't gotten around to it yet. She steps forward to enter, pauses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you're aware of the trust you endanger, Jean-Luc Picard. In my experience, it's unusual for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... an offlander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, smiles) For someone so young. Picard smiles, aware of a sexual tension... for the second time in his visit, a humming bird flitters by, briefly examining a street lamp and then away. She moves inside, glances back and smiles. Then she's gone. Picard turns and looks at the horizon where the sun will come up soon... reacts as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: THE SILHOUETTE OF GEORDI LA FORGE
dialogues.text: standing there, looking out at the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Picard moves over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi...? Geordi turns and Picard reacts as he sees Geordi's eyes... without the implants... Geordi smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funniest thing, Captain. There wasn't anything wrong with my implants. There was something right with my eyes. When Doctor Crusher removed the ocular connections, she found the cells around my optic nerves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... had regenerated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may not last after we leave. If not, I just wanted, before we go... (beat) I've never actually seen a sunrise. Picard considers him a long beat... and they turn to see

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: cracking the horizon turning the lake red...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND GEORDI
dialogues.text: bathed in the sunlight... Picard's face looking younger, contented in the new sun...

dialogues.speaker: THE SUNRISE
dialogues.text: ... the silhouette of an eagle-like bird coasting a foot above the water... the morning breeze brushing the red- tinged field of tall grass.

dialogues.speaker: GEORDI
dialogues.text: A tear rolls down his cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the sunlight cascades over the village and hills and if we weren't sure this place was magic before, we certainly know it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dwarf the Enterprise as they move into orbit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougherty and Ru'afo enter... Ru'afo is furious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to understand you're not releasing my men, Captain? Picard at his desk working, looks up, makes strong eye contact with his guests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I found the holoship. That stops Ru'afo. He looks at Dougherty who realizes some damage control will be necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ru'afo, why don't you let the  Captain and I... Ru'afo's face is so tight it seems it's going to break...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! ... and it does -- a crack opens up from his forehead to his chin and blood dribbles out of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This entire mission has been one Federation blunder after another. You will return my men or this alliance will end with the destruction of your ship. He exits. Dougherty measures Picard for a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking well, Jean-Luc. Rested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your "Briar Patch" turned out to be more hospitable than I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) That's why we put chromodynamic shields in place - so our people wouldn't feel the effects from the metaphasic radiation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... or understand that they were participating in the outright theft of a world. (beat) I won't let you move them, Admiral. I'll go to the Federation Council...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm acting on orders form the Federation Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts, beat) How can there be an order to abandon the Prime Directive...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prime Directive doesn't apply. These people are not indigenous to this world. They were never meant to be immortal. We'll simply be restoring their natural evolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we to decide the next course of evolution for these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are six hundred people down there. We'll be able to use the regenerative properties of this radiation to help billions. (beat) The Son'a have developed a procedure to collect the metaphasic particles form the planets rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A planet in Federation space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We have the planet and they have the technology -- a technology we can't duplicate. You know what that makes us? Their partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our partners are nothing more than petty thugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing that) On Earth, petroleum once turned petty thugs into world leaders. Warp drive transformed a bunch of Romulan thugs into an empire. We can handle the Son'a, I'm not worried about that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone probably said the same thing about the Romulans a  century ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With metaphasics, lifespans will be doubled... an entire new medical science will evolve... (beat) I understand your Chief Engineer has the use of his eyes for the first time in his life... would you take his sight away from him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are metaphasic particles all over The Briar Patch. Why must this planet be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
