dialogues.text: (interrupting) The concentration in the rings is what makes the whole damned thing work. Don't ask me to explain it. I only know they inject something into the rings that starts a thermolytic reaction. After it's over, the planet will be unlivable for generations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delay the procedure. Let my people look at the technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our best scientific minds already have. We can't find any other way to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the Son'a can establish a separate colony on this planet until we do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would take ten years of normal exposure to begin to reverse their condition. Some of them won't survive that long. Besides, they don't want to live in the middle of The Briar Patch... who would?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ba'ku. Picard and Dougherty look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are betraying the principles upon which the Federation was founded... this is an attack on the very soul of the Federation. (beat) This will destroy the Ba'ku. Just as cultures have been  destroyed in every other forced relocation throughout history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are only moving six hundred people, Jean-Luc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) How many people would it take... before it becomes wrong? A thousand? Fifty thousand. A million? Dougherty has taken this as far as he intends to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ordering you to the Goren system. File whatever protests you wish to. By the time you do, this will be all done. (moves to exit) I'm also ordering the release of the Son'a officers. He's out. Picard sits at his desk for a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf at Conn, Data at Ops, Riker at command... they look up at Picard as he comes out of the Ready Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare the ship for departure at oh-seven-hundred hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Data exchanges a curious glance with Riker as Picard crosses to the turbolift. Before he gets in, he turns and looks at his bridge, imprinting it on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he enters, stands in the middle of the room a long beat, his table still cluttered with charts and PADDS...

dialogues.speaker: CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: One pip is placed on top, a second, third and fourth...

dialogues.speaker: A TOOT
dialogues.text: (OPTICAL) as it's implanted into a very old man's mouth and now, the old fellow has a mouthful of bright new teeth... Gallatin enters, moving to --

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: sitting, his head locked in position by an apparatus... a female attendant actually giving him a facelift in front of our eyes... the device stretching his face ever tighter, as she snips off skin by one ear with a laser in a bloodless surgery that heals his wound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallatin! So the righteous Starfleet Captain finally released you. Did you encounter any problems on the surface?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acknowledges) No, sir. But it wasn't easy... being among them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. Just don't forget what they did to us. (Gallatin nods) We'll have them rounded up in a day or two... we needn't bother with the Federation holo-ship any more. Just get the holding cells ready. Gallatin acknowledges, leaves. To the attendant -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss these little flesh-stretching sessions of ours, my dear. As she pulls up his other ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard, out of uniform, works a transporter and cases of military supplies MATERIALIZE on a loading platform that will lower into the cargo hold of the yacht... he studies a translucent geological scan of the surface that we will hear more about later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re-routing the transport grid to avoid detection was wise, sir, but the transporter is rarely used after oh-two-hundred hours. Picard turns to see Data, Troi, Crusher, La Forge, Worf and Riker have entered the hatch. All but Riker and Geordi are out of uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking the Captain's yacht out for a spin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining the cargo) Seven metric tons of ultritium explosives, eight tetryon pulse launchers, ten isomagnetic disintegrators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be planning on doing some hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to your quarters (no one moves) That's an order. No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No uniform? No orders. Geordi, with his normal eyes, moves forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I look at another sunrise, knowing what my sight cost these people, Captain? Picard looks at them with appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel obliged to point out that the environmental anomalies may be stimulating certain rebellious instincts common to youth that could affect everyone's judgment. Except mine, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Data, what do you think we should do? Data looks to everyone, considering a beat... picks up a phaser rifle... activates it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saddle up. Lock and load. The family united looks to their Captain for instructions. Picard looks to them with deep affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't begin the procedure while the planet is inhabited. So, our job is to keep the planet inhabited. He looks at Riker and La Forge, knowing that his first officer and chief engineer must stay with the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back and put a face on what's happening here. Make the Council see the Ba'ku. It's too easy to turn a blind eye to the suffering of an unfamiliar people. Riker and La Forge acknowledge. Picard takes an extra moment to look, perhaps for the last time, into the eyes of his first officer with affection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a short letter I left you all, just some... sentimental nonsense... the computer will bring it to your attention at oh- four-hundred... I'd just as soon you delete it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat chance. I'll post it on every monitor on the ship... Picard grins with nice embarrassment, then with a serious look to Riker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll hold out as long as we can. Riker understands they're counting on him. Picard hits a panel and the weapons sink into the yacht... as the non-uniformed officers move to take their posts, Riker takes Troi in his arms, kisses her good-bye. The others react in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently the environmental anomalies are also stimulating...  Worf shuts him up with a hard look... Data gets the message, sits in a cockpit chair and quietly begins to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: falls away from the belly of the mother ship... and after a beat, the thrusters ignite and off they go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ru'afo watches a realistic simulation of a space procedure on a monitor... a small but sophisticated injector assembly sailing into the planet's rings begins to fire charges that start a thermolytic reaction (we see only the early stages here)... Gallatin enters with a PADD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injector performs perfectly in every simulation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, as the Enterprise left orbit, one of their support craft went down to the surface. (Ru'afo reacts, takes the PADD) It appeared to be the Captain's Yacht. Five persons on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not waiting until morning... take the shuttles and get everyone off the surface tonight. Gallatin starts to leave... pauses as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallatin, if Picard or any of his people interfere... eliminate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a door opening... as we hear a bell ringing... the face of Artim fills the screen... his eyes scared... and as we reveal his point of view of the village, it's a stunning sight -- Tournel pulling on the warning bell in the square... hundreds of people moving with urgency... supplies are being packed onto the backs of llamas... Worf, Data and Troi are unpacking the cases of military supplies that have already been loaded from the (unseen) yacht... Picard is going over charts with Anij  and Sojef near-by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib) What is it? What's going on? What's happened? Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving the village... take only what you need. Bring food... we may not be back for days... Artim jumps with a start as a slim, high-tech device on a stake suddenly lights up like a Christmas tree beside him... sees Data who just activated it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a transport inhibitor. It will help prevent Son'a ships from beaming anyone off the surface... Artim, overwhelmed and still scared of the android, backs away from Data without responding and moves toward his father. Picard is showing Anij and Sojef the translucent geo-scans we saw on the yacht...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... these are the veins of kelbonite running through the hills... the more concentrated the deposits the more trouble they'll have with their transporters... our route will keep us close to these deposits as possible... Artim moves beside his father, holds onto him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we're forced away by the terrain, we'll use transport inhibitors to compensate. The mountains have the highest concentrations. Once we're there, transport will be virtually impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are caves in those mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acknowledges) We can hold them off a long time... once we get there... (beat) But they will not make it easy to get there... Worf and Data move over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I've activated transport inhibitors around the village...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Let's begin to move these people out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I distribute phasers to the Ba'ku, sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We'll be responsible for that, Mister Worf. They all react to the sound of thrusters flying overhead... they look up to see --

dialogues.speaker: THE NIGHT SKY
dialogues.text: as Son'a shuttlecraft roar overhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporters are not functioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off sensors) They're blocking the beams with some kind of inhibitors. We'll have to locate and destroy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mass of people cross the fields.. the Starfleet officers separated at intervals among them, continuing to encourage and assist them forward... progress slows as they converge onto the narrow path leading into the hills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Sojef and Artim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to carry too much... we've got a long climb ahead of us... Suddenly, the ground shakes with booms as the ships overhead fire a series of air to surface missiles parallel to the path ahead... voices raise in fear, parents grab their children, people begin to move more quickly, some drop what they're carrying...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SON'A SHIP
dialogues.text: fires at the surface... we see the blast knock out...

dialogues.speaker: A TRANSPORT INHIBITOR
dialogues.text: that explodes...near-by --

dialogues.speaker: WORF
dialogues.text: reacts...moves to Picard and Anij guiding people up the narrow path as the explosions continue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost an inhibitor! There's a gap in the field...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As another wave of ships passes over, suddenly, with the moving sounds of ships above, people caught in the unprotected gap are swept away on a path of DEMATERIALIZATION...maybe fifty are just scooped away from the crowd... and now people are really panicking, screaming, cries, pushing forward... some scatter...

dialogues.speaker: ARTIM
dialogues.text: being pushed, trying to hang onto his father... but as the ships continue to pass over and the DEMATERIALIZATIONS in the same gap continue, suddenly Sojef is beamed away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father! His voice is lost in the cries of the scared people who surge even harder forward toward the protection of the next inhibitor and now the boy is thrust to the ground. As he falls, the little palm-pet slips out of his pocket... Artim desperately tries to save him from being stepped on, finally snatches him in his hand. But now the crush of people threatens to trample the boy and it's a reminder how scary it can be to be small. Suddenly, an arm reaches down and scoops him up... and as we follow Artim up, we can see it's Data who has rescued him... their eyes connect briefly as Data carries him forward... in the pushing crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the protected areas... we'll be safe when we get into the hills... The people file ahead up the path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougherty, Gallatin and Ru'afo study black and white aerial surveillance photographs of the Ba'ku exodus up the foothills. Dougherty is angry and embarrassed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're following the kelbonite deposits... using the interference to block our transporters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recommendations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me down. Let me talk to Picard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk... we should send down an assault team and take them by force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not an acceptable option. If people get hurt, all the support we have in the  Federation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federation support, Federation procedures, Federation rules... look in the mirror, Admiral... the Federation is old... in the last twenty four months, it's been challenged by every major power in the quadrant -- the Borg, the Cardassians, the Dominion... they all smell the scent of death on the Federation. That's why you've embraced our offer... because it will give your dear Federation new life. Well, how badly do you want it, Admiral? Because there are hard choices to be made now. If the Enterprise gets through with news about their brave Captain's valiant struggle on behalf of the defenseless Ba'ku, your Federation politicians will waver, your Federation opinion polls will open a public debate, your Federation allies will want their say... need I go on? Dougherty takes a deep breath... knows Ru'afo is right. Gallatin hates the idea of a violent assault, gives Dougherty the other option he's desperately seeking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an alternative to an all- out assault. Isolinear tags would allow our transporters to lock on to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to tag every one of them... that would take time... and we don't have it. The Enterprise is only nineteen hours from communications range with the Federation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll order Riker to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard's first officer. Do you really believe he'll listen? Ru'afo's clearly lost faith in the Admiral's ability to control the situation... Dougherty's jaw tightens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ships are capable of intercepting the Enterprise before it reaches the perimeter. I could send them to... escort... it back... but Commander Riker might not want to come... And we slowly push into Dougherty as he steps across his self-imposed moral line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send your ships. Dougherty tries to digest the knot in his stomach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep into the foothills now... much steeper terrain... feeling the power of the mountains near-by... seeing the path below as hundreds of Ba'ku and dozens of llamas wind their way up... it's almost biblical in scope with Picard and Moses leading the way...

dialogues.speaker: DATA AND ARTIM
dialogues.text: They've been walking silently for some time...Artim struggling inside to reconcile what he's been taught about machines and the experience he's had with Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father told me I shouldn't talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. They exchange a glance. Artim sighs, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everyone here agrees with him. I mean, you know, about machines. There was even a  big fight about it once. (beat) Do you like being a machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering) I aspire to be more than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why. (off Data's look) So people like us won't be afraid of you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Perhaps, that is true. The boy is obviously tired from miles of walking uphill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever get tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My power cells continually re- charge themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine what it would be like to be a machine. Data studies him... (and it should be noted that his responses are a deliberate attempt to enlighten Artim, give the child a new perspective on what it means to be an android.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it would surprise you to know that I have often tried to imagine what it would be like to be a child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with fatigue) For one thing, your legs are shorter than everyone else's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they are in a constant state of growth. Do you find it difficult to adapt? (off Artim's perplexed look) A child's specifications are never the same from one moment to the next. I am surprised that you do not... trip over your own feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My legs are eighty-seven-point- two centimeters. They were eighty-seven-point-two centimeters the day I was created. They will be eighty- seven-point-two centimeters the day I go off line. My operation depends on specifications that do not change. (beat) I... cannot imagine... the experience of growing up or even tripping over my own feet... Artim is seeing the artificial lifeform in a whole new light now, which is exactly what Data intended...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've never had adults telling you what to do all the time... or bedtimes... or having to eat food you don't like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would gladly accept the requirement of a bedtime in exchange for knowing what it is like to be a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering) Do machines ever play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play the violin... and my chess routines are quite advanced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean... He tries to find a way to explain, gets an idea -- pokes him with a finger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. And he starts to run away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm what? Artim frowns, stops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're it. And if you tag me... then I'm it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can run much faster than you... I am capable of exceeding forty-seven meters per second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, walking back) Data... haven't you ever just played... for fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Androids... don't have...fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) No one's ever asked me that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to know 'what it's like to be a child', you need to learn how to play... As Data considers...

dialogues.speaker: WITH PICARD AND ANIJ
dialogues.text: at point... walking up a part of the trail protected by towering rocks. Worf approaches from the rear... (Note: we may notice more physical changes in our people because of the regenerative process. For example, Picard's hair is darker and there actually seems to be a touch more of it growing than before... Worf's hair is more straggly, unkempt...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not serious) You need a haircut, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accelerated hair growth is often experienced by Klingons during Jak'tahla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jak'tahla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roughly translated: puberty... although for a Klingon that's not doing it justice... (to Worf) Any severe mood swings, unusual aggressive tendencies -- be sure to let me know right away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ba'ku could use some rest, sir. According to the geo-scan, this may be the safest area for the next few kilometers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. We'll take an hour. Break out some rations... Worf acknowledges, signals and the column lumbers to a halt... people sit along the trail...

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE BEND
dialogues.text: A spectacular view of the mountains ahead... Picard and Anij move forward through some brush, lay on their stomachs as Picard uses 24th century field glasses to examine the path ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right beyond that ridge is where the caves begin... we can hide for days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now the Son'a have scanned the area and know that just as well as we do. She studies him as he continues to survey the territory they must still cross... on a whim, she reaches out and runs a finger across his bald head... he looks up, surprised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's been three hundred years since I've seen a bald man. He grins, studies her... they feel the sexual tension... after a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it a woman like you never married? And don't tell me you "just haven't gotten around to it yet"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I should warn you... I've always been attracted to older women... She looks seriously at him, takes his hand in hers, guides both hands to touch his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and in that moment, his perception and our view  begin to move down her arm... and we enter...

dialogues.speaker: AN ALTERED REALITY
dialogues.text: Picard, and we, find ourselves in a heightened state of sensory perception -- time seems to be slowing down to a crawl, sounds are sharper... we hear Picard's heart beating slowly with a booming percussion... he follows he gaze to see yet another humming bird, hears its languid w motion... swirling dust from the mountain seems like a  zipping scarf in a breeze that plays in his ears like a natural flute... his breath becomes more even as he relaxes into this altered state and he feels...

dialogues.speaker: HER FINGERS
dialogues.text: gently touching the hair at the top of his chest, sensing, even hearing, her fingertips against his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: HER LIPS
dialogues.text: brush his cheek, his lips... her teeth nip gently on his lower lip, tugging it and then her lips press against his for an eternity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving at one-third impulse through The Briar Patch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker at Command, Perim at Conn, La Forge at Ops, Nara at Tactical, supernumeraries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, I'm showing two Son'a ships on an intercept course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long 'til they reach us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to be able to get a transmission out of here for at least another hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hailing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them our transceiver assembly is down, that we can send messages but can't receive them. Nara sends the message... a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they believe us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Boom... a small explosion well off target... the ship shakes gently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off sensors) A photon torpedo. (dry) Isn't that the universal greeting when communications are down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's the universal greeting when you don't like someone. Another boom shakes them slightly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full impulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manifold can't handle full impulse in the Patch, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't outrun them, the manifolds are going to be the only thing left of this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I'll be in Engineering. La Forge exits. A supernumerary quickly replaces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands. Battle stations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have you noticed how your boobs have started to firm up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Not that we care about such things in this day and age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Data glances at their breasts as he hands them plates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Data. We stay with him as he takes the tray to Worf who looks at the plate with disdain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an odd craving for the blood of a live Kolar beast. (off Data's look) The environment must be affecting me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) And have you noticed how your boobs have started to firm up? (Worf reacts) Not that we care about such things in this day and age. Suddenly, the distant sound of approaching thrusters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming over the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits combadge) Take cover!

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND ANIJ
dialogues.text: moving back toward the others... look up to see --

dialogues.speaker: SON'A SHUTTLES
dialogues.text: overhead, dropping dozens of...

dialogues.speaker: FLYING DRONES
dialogues.text: the size of footballs with parts rotating, blinking, scanning...

dialogues.speaker: FLYING ABOVE THE TRAIL
dialogues.text: The Ba'ku scattering as drones fly over them...

dialogues.speaker: DATA AND ARTIM
dialogues.text: react, Data firing at the drones as Artim crawls behind a rock...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD AND WORF
dialogues.text: open fire with phasers destroying two, but the third fires a new kind of weapon hitting --

dialogues.speaker: A BA'KU WOMAN'S BACK
dialogues.text: as it's tagged with a tiny device fired from the drone...

dialogues.speaker: THE BA'KU WOMAN
dialogues.text: DEMATERIALIZES... a fraction of a beat later, Picard blasts the drone... more people DEMATERIALIZE as the drone attacks continue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolinear tags. Their transporters can lock onto them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find shelter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cavern at the base of the next hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signaling to the others) This way!

dialogues.speaker: THRU
dialogues.text: 175 on our principles providing covering fire as the Ba'ku move quickly ahead... more drones fly in, firing their tags, more Ba'ku are hit and DEMATERIALIZE... our people fire repeated bursts destroying several of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dangerous variation on your game of 'tag', Artim. Hurry we most definitely do not want to be 'it'... He blasts a drone as they push ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exchanging fire with the two Son'a ships in pursuit, a trail of hot exhaust coming from the Enterprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously damaged... plasma leaks, smoke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields at sixty percent... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineering to Bridge. We're burning deuterium down here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impulse engines smoking... engineers spray coolant foam over them to keep the temperatures from red-lining...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to blow ourselves up... we won't need any help from the Son'a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge nebula cluster up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's inside that nebula cluster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cometary debris, pockets of unstable metreon gas... we don't want to go in there, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we do. (pats her shoulder) You're relieved, Ensign. Take over at Ops. He takes the Conn... Perim  replaces the officer at Ops..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to use "The Briar Patch" like B'rer Rabbit did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: making a hard turn and disappearing into the cluster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ba'ku run for their lives toward the mouth of a cavern, steam coming up from the hot mineral waters within it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the cavern! Move! And our people continue to blast the swarming drones above but there are so many of them... several Ba'ku are tagged and DISAPPEAR...

dialogues.speaker: WITH WORF
dialogues.text: as his phaser jams and he picks up a thin tree trunk and with Klingon howls, swings it like a bat'leth at the drones... missing one but then connecting with another and a second one knocking them out of the park like Hank Aaron... glancing to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely feeling aggressive tendencies...

dialogues.speaker: DATA AND ARTIM
dialogues.text: surrounded by Ba'ku as they move quickly along a very steep trail, Data firing at drones as they go... suddenly just in front of them, a Son'a assault team appears over the ridge... three armed foot soldiers ready to take prisoners... Data lunges, like a running back hitting a defensive line and his power throws them back and they fall...

dialogues.speaker: OFF THE CLIFF
dialogues.text: the long terrible fall beginning...

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: thinks fast, snatches a passing drone out of the air and aims it at...

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE FALLING SON'A
dialogues.text: and as they're tagged, they DEMATERIALIZE in free-fall.

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: looks down, satisfied, then crushes the drone with his bare hands and provides more cover fire as the Ba'ku move quickly to the cavern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying through dark matter clouds and stellar debris which light up as Son'a torpedoes explode all around them... suddenly there is a different kind of blast off the Enterprise's stern -- a bright implosion, sucking up everything around it, literally ripping subspace apart as it cascades toward the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terribly rough ride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they've detonated an isolytic burst... a subspace tear is forming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: As Riker sees the tear coming at them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought subspace weapons were banned by the Khitomer Accord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to lodge a protest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, our warp core is acting like a magnet to the tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi on the move to a new control panel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pulling it like a zipper across space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Options?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eject the core. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the viewscreen shows the tear getting closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will that stop the tear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your expert opinion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detonating the warp core might neutralize the cascade... but then again it might not. Subspace weapons are unpredictable. That's why they were banned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tear is closing on us... impact in fifteen seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eject the core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impact in ten seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detonate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: presses the panels to detonate and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rips toward the Enterprise as the ejected warp core explodes. The subspace disruption that follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throws everybody down. Consoles explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panels are blown off, fires break out, lights fail, people thrown to the ground. As it subsides, Riker crawls back to Conn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked, Commander... the tear's been sealed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to stop them from doing it again... and we're fresh out of warp cores...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still thirty-six minutes from transmission range, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, deciding) We're through running from these bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, steamy, wet environment... pools of mineral water drizzle along the floor... the Ba'ku and their llamas slosh through the mud, seeking some kind of comfortable place to rest...

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Where a forcefield has been established across the mouth of the cave... the drones try to get in and are blocked; they hover menacingly outside... Data moves to Picard from the interior of the cave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Data) How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another forty-three people reported taken, sir... Picard frowns, sighs, takes in their new surroundings... suddenly, the caverns are shaken by the sound of overhead explosions... reactions, fearful murmurs, skittish llamas...

dialogues.speaker: ON ARTIM
dialogues.text: sitting with other Ba'ku... they look up at the frightening sound... sand drifting dangerously from the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: ARTIM'S POCKET
dialogues.text: The palm-pet crawls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Son'a shuttles fly over firing torpedoes, explosions across the terrain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Picard et al react to the aerial assault... ground continually shuddering... Picard and Worf exchange a grim look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to force us out so their drones can tag us... Picard nods, agreeing. As dust falls from the ceiling and the blasts continue to rock them... Data studies his tricorder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the hydrothermal vents in the substrata, the structural integrity of this cavern is not going to hold for long, Captain... Picard glances out at a half-dozen drones hovering outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other way out of here? Anij shakes her head, grim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking the water flow may reveal another potential exit... As they use tricorders to follow the water flow deeper into the cavern...

dialogues.speaker: NARROWER PORTION OF THE CAVE
dialogues.text: as the flow of water disappears under a wall... the air assault continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) I'm showing fresh air (TECH BETTER) behind this calcite formation, Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the structure hold if we blast through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examines walls with tricorder) I believe it is safe, sir. Using their phasers, they blast the wall away, crawl through the new hole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they come out and turn to see several paths up to rocky mountains not far away, distant cave openings in view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out as far as you can... get everyone into those caves, set up forcefields once you're inside... With renewed optimism, they go to gather up the Ba'ku...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming about...

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: Riker at Conn as messed up as we've ever seen him, his face a study in determination. The bridge is barely functional. Pockets of colorful gases are visible on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geordi, are those pockets of metreon gas...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off an Okudagram --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Highly volatile...I recommend we keep our distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. I want to use the ramscoop to collect as much of it as we can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The purpose being...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The purpose being I intend to shove it down the Son'a's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, if one of their weapons hits that gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our only way out of here, Mister Nara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Geordi goes to work, nods with admiration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be surprised if history remembers this as the Riker Maneuver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it works you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if it doesn't, they'll be teaching kids as the Academy not to do this for years to come.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAMSCOOP
dialogues.text: as it begins to sweep up the gases... compressing them into a critical mass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge, storage cells are at maximum capacity -- five thousand cubic meters of metreon gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, access manual steering column. In an instant, a joystick pops up from the control. He grabs the stick... a computer gamester's dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfer helm controls to manual. The computer bleeps. As the fog clears, we can see on the screen that we're closing fast on the Son'a ships...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're powering their forward weapons array.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow out the ramscoop. Stand by full thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramscoop released! Riker hits panels and the ship lurches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turning away as the Son'a ships fire and wham, the gases erupt... the Enterprise careens away out of control as the Son'a ships are hit by the explosion's full force. Both catch seriously on fire. After a beat, one explodes into bits... the other one sits there, helplessly on fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aerial assault continues as people file out the new exit... sand drifting dangerously from the ceiling ass th bombs shake the cavern... Data looks at a tricorder... moves to Picard. Just outside the new exit, a series of plasma blasts are fired from a nearby hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there! He points to a small squadron of Son'a that have spotted them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data, Troi... keep these people moving. Worf, with me... They arm themselves, Worf takes a new bazooka-like weapon, an isomagnetic disintegrator, and they move out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf and Picard provide cover as Data and Troi lead more people toward the mountains... Worf fires his disintegrator...

dialogues.speaker: THE SON'A ASSAULT TEAM
dialogues.text: is blown back as it connects... one of the wounded falls, sliding a long way down the hill, landing near the cave...

dialogues.speaker: CRUSHER
dialogues.text: scans the unconscious Son'a with a tricorder. Her eyes react as she sees something else on the tricorder... this is impossible, she checks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... Picard moves over cautiously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But look at this medscan... He looks at the tricorder, reacts incredulously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this be possible? She shakes her head, looks back to the cavern entrance where Anij and Tournel are assisting the last Ba'ku out of the cave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should ask them. Data and Troi return to lead the last group out of the cave...

dialogues.speaker: HYDOTHERMAL CAVERN
dialogues.text: Artim is among a dozen of so of the Ba'ku waiting to be taken...he reaches into his pocket for his palm-pet, can't find it... he reacts... he moves into the main cavern away from the others... a beat later, Anij and Tournel ready the group...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking for) The boy... They check the immediate vicinity... no Artim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. She moves toward the main cavern...

dialogues.speaker: WITH ARTIM
dialogues.text: back in the corner where he found the rifle, finding his pet crawling slowly on the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artim! What are you doing? She doesn't bother waiting for an answer... just grabs him and pulls him along with her in a hurry...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE, (SECOND)
dialogues.text: Picard, Worf, Data, Troi and Crusher arrive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij went to find Artim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him. At the sound of her voice, Picard moves toward the main cavern...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE CAVERN
dialogues.text: And we see Anij and Artim maybe thirty yards away from Picard... running now... coming this way... suddenly, wham... a rocket hits the mountainside and the ground shudders... and the ceiling starts to collapse... and...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD'S EYES
dialogues.text: connect with...

dialogues.speaker: ANIJ'S EYES
dialogues.text: for an instant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard reaches out for her... just as the whole thing comes down on both of them... Picard throws Artim out of the cave just in front of the collapse into the arms of...

dialogues.speaker: DATA
dialogues.text: who pulls him safely away from the collapse... The Starfleet officers move back to examine the collapsed mouth of the cave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Artim) Tournel will take you the rest of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I want to stay with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is safer there. I will join you shortly. Artim reluctantly goes and the last people cross the divide with Tournel. Overlapping the above dialogue --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (press combadge) Worf to Picard. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) Two life signs... one extremely faint...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off tricorder) There are almost four metric tons of rock blocking our way... She aims a phaser at the rocks, but Worf stops her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might cause another cave-in. They have no choice... they start digging furiously... Data picking up rocks that no human could lift...  Worf refusing to surrender to his own physical limitations... Beverly and Troi do the best they can... Tournel takes the last children across the divide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost pitch black... finding Picard under rubble, his face cut, dazed, shaking himself back to consciousness... hoarsely cries out for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij... He gropes around for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... yes, I... can hear you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to get to you, sir... Picard begins to crawl around in the darkness and finally comes to motionless body of Anij...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij. She barely opens her eyes... Picard looks to see if he still has his tricorder; he does... he trains it on her... the reading are not good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help is coming. She looks at him and tries to smile, but it's too much... and her eyes close... and the tricorder tells Picard she's on the edge of death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf, you must hurry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming as fast as we can... we can't risk using phasers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Tell Doctor Crusher to have a hypospray of lectrazine ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad is she, Captain...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm losing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming. Picard takes Anij's hand and holds it to his own cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with me... don't let go of this moment, Anij... help me find the power to make you live in this moment... just one more moment... and then one more after that... and one more after that. Her eyes weakly open one last time and look at him...and as their eyes connect... once again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as his consciousness moves down her arm and as the bond is formed... he experiences --

dialogues.speaker: AN ALTERED REALITY
dialogues.text: with heightened senses again as time seems to slow down, her eyelids thumping slowly louder and louder... and as they hold the moment the cavern seems to light up with the metaphysical energy they're emanating... and it's like Picard has thrown her a mystical lifeline to hold onto... his eyes are her eyes as life seeps into them... the moment seems to last forever... she smiles gently and finally sunlight cracks into the cavern as Data and Worf break through... Crusher crawls in and uses the hypospray an Anij's neck... measures her lifesigns with the tricorder, smiles at Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's stabilizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe to move her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safer than leaving her here. Picard kneels and picks her up in his arms... Anij looks weakly at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought it would take centuries to learn. He smiles with affection at her... and they all exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Beverly, Worf, Troi, Data and Picard, carrying Anij, come out to cross the divide... and they stop dead in their tracks... as they see --

dialogues.speaker: FIVE DRONES HOVERING
dialogues.text: menacingly between them and the safety of the mountain caverns... and as we intercut between the drones and

dialogues.speaker: THE FACES OF OUR HEROES
dialogues.text: we understand a classic showdown is imminent... an O.K. Corral moment... and all this happens very fast: our people stand shoulder to shoulder each a yard apart... Picard gently lowers Anij to the ground... Worf tosses him a spare phaser rifle... as he catches it...

dialogues.speaker: THE DRONES
dialogues.text: open fire...

dialogues.speaker: THRU
dialogues.text: 238 Our people react... move, duck and roll, tags just missing them, as they fire back... only Picard stands motionless on one knee protecting Anij... one, two, three, four drones are destroyed but the fifth fires, tagging Anij... Picard instantly reaches for her tag, but then he feels the sting of...

dialogues.speaker: A TAG
dialogues.text: on the side of his jacket; he reaches to pull it off but it's too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEMATERIALIZE together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in orbit of the Ba'ku planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: escorted by Gallatin, enters a cavernous brig filled with Ba'ku, perhaps as many as eighty of them...his eyes looking for --

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: stroking Anij's hair as she lies weakly next to him and Sojef. A beat as he locks eyes with Dougherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order them to surrender, and I promise you won't be court- martialed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a court-martial is the only way to tell the people of the Federation what happened here, then I welcome it. Ru'afo enters, controlled rage, hands a PADD to Dougherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise has destroyed one of my ships. The other is on fire, requesting assistance. A beat. Picard reacts as Dougherty studies the PADD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dougherty) The Enterprise would only fire if it were defending itself. Ru'afo must have ordered the attack. (beat) I can't believe he would've given that order without your consent, Admiral. Dougherty maintains eye contact but has completely lost his dignity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder... which one of us will be facing that court-martial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ru'afo) There's nothing further to be gained from this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. This is going to end now. (to Picard) The Ba'ku want to stay on the planet. Let them. I'm going to launch the injector... Gallatin's face reacts to that...Picard sees his sharp displeasure and then for an instant their eyes meet. Gallatin looks away, but Picard registers the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to launch  anything until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In six hours, every living thing in this system will be dead or dying. He starts to exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would kill your own people, Ru'afo? Your own parents, your brothers, sisters... (off Dougherty's look) Didn't you know, Admiral? The Ba'ku and the Son'a are the same race. Dougherty, confused, looks to Ru'afo... who doesn't look back... Sojef stands and comes forward... to Ru'afo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one were you? Gal'na... Ro'tin...Belath'nin... I'm sorry, I don't recognize you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those names, those children are gone forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A century ago, a group of our young people wanted to follow the ways of the offlanders. They tried to take over the colony... and when they failed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we failed, you exiled us. To die slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anij gathers the strength to look at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Ro'tin, aren't you...? There's something in the voice. (to Gallatin) Would you be his friend Gal'na? (Gallatin looks away) I helped your mother bathe you when you were a child. She still speaks of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dougherty) You've brought the Federation into the middle of a blood feud, Admiral. The children have returned to expel their elders... just as they were once expelled. Except Ru'afo's need for revenge has now escalated to parricide. Ru'afo exits. Gallatin looks at Sojef and then follows. Dougherty is a lost man, realizing his tragic errors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was for the Federation. It was all for the Federation. Picard offers no sympathy... Dougherty turns and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted as Ru'afo enters, his face full of tension... he moves to a device that bombards his face with pulsating green energy, trying to relax... Dougherty enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking this ship out of here... this mission is over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is over. Ru'afo moves away from the device and grabs Dougherty roughly... moving him across the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not take orders from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you begin the procedure while the planet is still populated, the Federation will pursue you until... Ru'afo, more powerful than Dougherty, throws him down into one of the treatment chairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federation... He locks Dougherty's head into the device... switches several panels... the device lights up ominously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... will never know what happened here. He hits a switch and begins to raise Dougherty's ears in the facelift procedure we saw before... Dougherty struggles but Ru'afo holds him down... as the Admiral's twists and morphs into a grotesque facelift that finally strangles him to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ru'afo enters...Gallatin and officers on duty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Dougherty will not be joining us for diner. Deploy the collector. (Gallatin hesitates) Do you have a problem with those orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I talk to you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another officer) Deploy the collector. The officer complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving them is one thing. Killing them all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one hated them more than you, Gal'na. (beat, intimately) We've come a long way together. This is the moment we've planned for so many years... Gallatin looks at his friend, his commander... Ru'afo pats him encouragingly on the shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Separate the Starfleet personnel and secure them in the aft cargo hold... see that Picard joins them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shields in that section won't protect them against the thermolytic reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you for reminding me. He sits in his command seat and watches his viewscreen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OPTICAL) as huge hatches open and the particle collector that will capture the metaphasic radiation from the rings slowly extends out in both directions. After a beat, Gallatin exits... push in to Ru'afo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an Astrodome-sized chamber full of weird crisscrossing patterns of pipes, conduits, cables, and rails -- all of them stretching slowing outward as the collector expands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begin to unfurl majestically in front of the planet's rings... and now we recognize it as the remarkable device we saw earlier in Ru'afo's simulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard has climbed the rear wall with help from two Ba'ku, examines the forcefield generators in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a warning) Jean-Luc... Gallatin arrives... armed with a hand weapon. Aiming it at Picard, he turns off the forcefield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Picard measures him for a moment then comes out, smiles 'don't worry' to Anij... Gallatin restores the field and motions for Picard to exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walking to a turbolift... unusually cordial considering the circumstances --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have been very strange for you. (off his look) When you were a hostage. Being among the friends and families you knew so many years ago. All of them looking exactly as they did. Almost like... looking through the eyes of childhood again. Gallatin presses a panel at the lift... Picard fixes his eyes on him, evenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you are trying to close those eyes again... to pretend you can't see what the bitterness has done to your people... what it's done to Ru'afo... and to you (beat) It's turned you... into a coward. (off his reaction) A man who ignores his conscience. The turbolift arrives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. Picard enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coward... without the moral courage to stop an unspeakable atrocity. You offend me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Is this how a Federation officer begs for his life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not begging for my life. I'm begging for yours. (beat) There is still a way home, Gal'na. Gallatin looks at Picard a long, miserable beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, close turbolift doors. The doors close. Gallatin lowers his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're asking me to do... is impossible... the crew is loyal to Ru'afo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to disable the injector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) But I would need at least three minutes on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could lure him away from the bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) It doesn't matter where he is. As soon as he realizes something is happening, he'll override my commands with one word at his com- link...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, an idea) What if he doesn't realize something's happening... (Gallatin reacts, confused) Can you get me to a transmitter? I have to speak with Worf and Data on the surface... we'll need their help... As Gallatin acknowledges, still uncertain what Picard's up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deck twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sails fully extended now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initiate launch sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activating injector assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch in (TECH) minutes. Establish a digital display near Ru'afo's command post that shows (time TECH) counting down. Ru'afo is calm, determined. Suddenly a tiny boom. Reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small craft is coming up from the surface. It's firing tachyon bursts at us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. On the screen, the Captain's yacht approaches, firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One person aboard. It's the android. Ru'afo dismisses the puny attack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's no threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: firing at the Son'a ship... the solar collector continuing to power up in the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data is alone... presses the companel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crawling through the narrow passage behind Gallatin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they're ignoring my attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep firing tachyon bursts into their shield grid. Is Worf in position...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He's ready for simultaneous transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be at the bridge in two minutes... Picard out... Data moves the ship into an attack posture, diving at the larger vessel seen in the window... firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The collector on the viewscreen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detonation in three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the Federation ship is creating a disruption in our shields... if they go out of phase, it will increase our exposure to the thermolytic reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, irritated) Very well. Destroy that ship and reset our shield harmonics... do not delay the countdown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is hit by a concentrated burst of fire from the Son'a ship... it goes spinning out of control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data tries to control the yacht. He's hit again... his whole console is smoking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console) Data to Picard. They are rotating the shield harmonics. I am attempting to return to the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federation ship has been disabled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch in thirty seconds. Suddenly, there is an extended optical flash (note: long enough to cover a brief transporter effect). Reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (the effect ends) Systems don't seem affected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch in fifteen seconds. See the digital countdown display at 00:15.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: to see the collector with its sails fully extended...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds. A tiny section of the collector is launched toward the rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Injector assembly launched. As it enters, it begins to disperse charges that set off a chain reaction in the ring system... the very nature of the rings changes before our eyes, and flumes of particulate matter scatter away. The process continues racing along the rings...  all of this is seen on the viewscreen...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: He watches mesmerized, his vengeance finally satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly as the simulations predicted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I am not showing any change in metaphasic flux levels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your scanners must be malfunctioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console, puzzled) All ship functions are off-line. Ru'afo reacts, turns to a station and presses panels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can there be no ship functions if the viewscreen is working, artificial gravity is stable, life support is... But his eyes catch something. He moves across the bridge to a small visual gap where a holo-grid is visible... his eyes react with horror... he reaches out, touches it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holodeck? He takes out a disruptor and fires it at the wall revealing a further portion of the holo-grid in the same effect we saw earlier with Picard and Data...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holodeck? He fires again and again...revealing more of the grid... his repeated blasting eventually reveals a short flight of stairs... he leads the way up them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely more than a cockpit with a large window into space as they enter, Ru'afo reacts as he sees the rings are normal... his own ship is right there in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, realizing) We were transported to the holo- ship when we reset our shields. Everything we saw... was an illusion. (hitting his com-link) Ru'afo, authorization delta two- one... override all interlink commands to injector assembly one. He stands there, but his com-link responds simply...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to comply. Injector assembly one has been de- activated. On his reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Picard, Worf and Gallatin are firmly in command... see the real countdown display has been frozen at 2:12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All injector sub-systems are confirmed off-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decloak the holo-ship and engage a tractor beam, Mister Worf. As Worf presses panels and the holo-ship DECLOAKS on the viewscreen, Picard presses a companel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard to Data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the ship re-enters the planet's atmosphere, shaking badly, heating up... a piece of the roof breaks off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precarious, sir... I am having trouble re-entering the atmosphere... I believe I will have to transport to the surface... Data is heating up and turning red just as the rest of the ship is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you, sir. He DEMATERIALIZES.  A beat later, the yacht disintegrates in the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ru'afo is frustrated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ship is equipped with fourteen long range transporters... are they all useless...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working the console) They must have been locked and secured after we were beamed here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolate one and re-route its command sequence through the auxiliary processor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there's nothing we can do... they already have control of our ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't plan on going back to our ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on it's way back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riker at Command, La Forge at Ops, Perim at Conn, Nara at Tactical. Basic repairs have been done, but the bridge still shows signs of the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're within sensor range of the Son'a ship. I'm picking up Captain Picard's com-signal on board... Off Riker's reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise to Picard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) Number one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be at your position in seven minutes. Do you need assistance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Did you succeed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Council has ordered a halt to the Ba'ku relocation while they conduct a top-level review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top level review, my ass. There'll be no cover-up of this. Not after I get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... He motions to the digital display... counting backwards at 2:05 now... Picard reacts... Gallatin works the controls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown control has been transferred to the collector...I can't override...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scan for lifesigns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. It's Ru'afo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you beam him off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. He's established a security field around the control room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other way to disable the injector? Gallatin thinks, then calls up...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER DISPLAY SHOWING THE
dialogues.text: INJECTOR ASSEMBLY isolating the section that we saw launched into the rings in the simulation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to remove the ignition matrix directly from the injector assembly... but in less than two minutes, that injector is going to be launched into the rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I volunteer to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picard moves toward a transporter station, starts to Remove his jacket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denied, Commander. I have no intention of informing your bride that you're not coming home... The countdown is at 1:41...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weird cavernous room is left with a skeleton of structured elements now that all the sails are fully unfurled... it almost reminds of the support foe an old- time roller coaster -- a cobweb of crisscrossing pipes, and conduits and planks...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: in a control area safely removed from the injector, working controls... the digital display moving back from 1:35... he doesn't immediately see --

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: MATERIALIZING... near the injector. This is not an area built for manned operation... so Picard has to make do with the structural elements... he's been beamed to a platform a few yards from the injector... and now he has to crawl across what is essentially a plank on his back... under the injector assembly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving across the plank... the dark recesses of the vast chamber below him... he slides into the assembly's grill, with many open spaces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where another digital display shows the countdown at 1:19...he takes a Son'a tool out of a pouch on his costume... goes to work, still lying on his back... he inserts the tool and removes the panel cover to expose the interior of the ignition matrix...

dialogues.speaker: WITH RU'AFO, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: as an alarm goes off on his console...he reacts... switches off the forcefield and goes out to look up at --

dialogues.speaker: PICARD, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: working on the injector...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Ru'afo climbs toward Picard...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: knows he's running out of time now... he works on removing an interior safety screen that shields the components... it finally slips off and falls, clanging as it hits structural elements below... the countdown hits 1:09...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: climbs...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: reaches in to pull out the ignition matrix but a small forcefield blocks his hand... he frowns... examines the security sensors, begins to disconnect them...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: starts to cross a plank toward Picard... their eyes connect...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE INJECTOR'S GRILL
dialogues.text: Picard succeeds in defeating the security system... the forcefield fritzes off... the countdown at :47... he reaches for the component but Ru'afo gets there first... lunges at Picard, seconds before he can complete his task. They grapple across the grill and Picard slips through one of the openings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Picard barely catching himself by grabbing on to the grill...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: scrambles onto the assembly, reaches Picard and starts  to uncurl...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD'S FINGERS
dialogues.text: holding onto the grill... trying to force him to let go...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: grimaces, looks to see:

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: The ignition matrix engages and the nitrogen flow that follows throws Ru'afo slightly off-balance... Picard knowing it's now or never, releases one hand and grabs Ru'afo by the neck and yanks his head down hard against the grill, stunning him... Picard pulls himself up and moves quickly into the blinding nitrogen toward the detonation circuit again... he literally disappears for a brief second... as Ru'afo comes back at him again... the countdown at :10... Ru'afo pulls him away from the controls... :05... Picard leaps for the plank he crawled over on... Ru'afo looks at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and it's gone!

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: reacts... looks at...

dialogues.speaker: PICARD
dialogues.text: on the plank who holds up the circuit for him to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: perhaps no more than a foot apart... but an instant later, Ru'afo slides away with the injector as it's launched... a protective forcefield zaps into place as it enters space... Picard watches as it moves toward the rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw in the simulation, the injector continues to move toward the rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see the rings getting closer and closer... and as we burst into them... the bright colorful metaphasic dust and gases swirling around us like a hurricane...

dialogues.speaker: RU'AFO
dialogues.text: begins to change... growing younger and younger... face- lift falls into middle-age... then taking on the Ba'ku facial skin pattern as he reaches young adulthood... then adolescence... then childhood. White out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ba'ku returning from the hills... Troi waves from a distance... and we move to see Riker, standing with Worf (back in uniform), waving back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I mentioned the unanticipated rewards I've discovered in a permanent relationship...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Permanent'... that sounds like a long time, Worf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with irony) Life is short, Commander. Worf leaves Riker to think about that... and as we move away with him, he takes us to Gallatin watching the children play tag in the high grass with a personal longing.

dialogues.speaker: SEE PICARD, ANIJ AND SOJEF
dialogues.text: walking slowly observing Gallatin. Anij is almost fully recovered. Picard is back in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish there was a way to bring them back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there's too much bitterness... on both sides. They pause as they notice Crusher escorting a young Ba'ku woman... returning from the mountains... she tries to recognize Gallatin... we're too far away to hear what is said... but the woman embraces Gallatin as a mother embraces a lost son... and Crusher looks over and smiles to Picard... before she leaves the couple alone...  Anij looks to Picard, realizing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and son. You arranged this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it might begin the healing process. Sojef considers Picard, shakes his hand with a unstated but deep appreciation for all that this offlander has done. He moves away to join Gallatin and his mother. Anij looks to Picard with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do without you? Picard reacts, slightly surprised that she has anticipated that he has to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are perilous times for the Federation. I can't abandon it to people who would threaten everything I've spent a lifetime defending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to Earth to... slow things down... at the Federation Council. She nods, she knows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have three hundred and eighteen days of vacation time coming. I plan on using them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be here. Worf moves over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the Ticonderoga has moved into orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worf! They turn to see a Ferengi (QUARK) approaching in a bathing suit with a beach umbrella and two barely dressed Dabo girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Quark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing everyone else in the quadrant is going to be doing here... as soon as I build the greatest spa in the galaxy... (sotto) ... these people don't have any religious thing about casinos do they...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't going to be any spas on this planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the question) This world is about to become a Federation protectorate, which will end any and all attempts at exploitation by people like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain to me how five thousand time-share units... right there along the lake... would be 'exploiting' anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Worf, have this uninvited... offlander and his quests beamed to the Enterprise. We'll deposit them at Deep Space Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must you, sir? Worf takes Quark away by the scruff of his beach shirt... his disappointed babes follow ...trailing away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll hear from my Nagus. They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think your mighty Federation would be interested in protecting six hundred people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "mighty" Federation could learn a few things from this village... He kisses her. The signature humming bird appears, sweeping up in the breeze and hovers briefly in front of them... and as he takes her hand to his cheek...

dialogues.speaker: THE HUMMING BIRD, (OPTICAL)
dialogues.text: slows... its wing movements becoming more fluid and gentle... as the moment extends...

dialogues.speaker: TROI, CRUSHER, WORF, LA FORGE AND RIKER
dialogues.text: prepared to transport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Data?

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH GRASS
dialogues.text: a shot like our opening shot...except the head that peeks through the grass this time is Data's... and as we widen, we see he has taken Artim's earlier advice and is playing tag with all the kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Data! It's time to go! Data stands up straight as he hears the voice, looks at Artim a long beat... and this is a kid's moment, underplaying the sentiment the way kids would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Data nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Artim smiles as Data joins the others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget -- you've got to  play a little bit every day. Data acknowledges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good advice. Riker takes Troi's hand suggesting perhaps a new permanent commitment. Picard moves to join the others, presses his combadge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise... seven to beam up. Energize. Picard exchanges a final look with Anij as they DEMATERIALIZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaves orbit and as it moves into space... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: geovisit();
